deeperwin.kfac_ferminet_alpha.loss_functions.NegativeLogProbLoss

class deeperwin.kfac_ferminet_alpha.loss_functions.NegativeLogProbLoss(weight: Union[float, jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray])[source]

Bases: deeperwin.kfac_ferminet_alpha.loss_functions.LossFunction

Abstract base class for loss functions that are negative log probs.

multiply_fisher(vector: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray[source]

Right-multiply a vector by the Fisher.

Parameters

vector – The vector to multiply. Must be the same shape(s) as the ‘inputs’ property.

Returns

The vector right-multiplied by the Fisher. Will be of the same shape(s) as the ‘inputs’ property.

multiply_fisher_factor(vector: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray[source]

Right-multiply a vector by a factor B of the Fisher.

Here the ‘Fisher’ is the Fisher information matrix (i.e. expected outer- product of gradients) with respect to the parameters of the underlying probability distribution (whose log-prob defines the loss). Typically this will be block-diagonal across different cases in the batch, since the distribution is usually (but not always) conditionally iid across different cases.

Note that B can be any matrix satisfying B * B^T = F where F is the Fisher, but will agree with the one used in the other methods of this class.

Parameters

vector – The vector to multiply. Must be of the shape given by the ‘fisher_factor_inner_shape’ property.

Returns

The vector right-multiplied by B. Will be of the same shape(s) as the ‘inputs’ property.

multiply_fisher_factor_transpose(vector: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray[source]

Right-multiply a vector by the transpose of a factor B of the Fisher.

Here the ‘Fisher’ is the Fisher information matrix (i.e. expected outer- product of gradients) with respect to the parameters of the underlying probability distribution (whose log-prob defines the loss). Typically this will be block-diagonal across different cases in the batch, since the distribution is usually (but not always) conditionally iid across different cases.

Note that B can be any matrix satisfying B * B^T = F where F is the Fisher, but will agree with the one used in the other methods of this class.

Parameters

vector – The vector to multiply. Must be the same shape(s) as the ‘inputs’ property.

Returns

The vector right-multiplied by B^T. Will be of the shape given by the ‘fisher_factor_inner_shape’ property.

multiply_fisher_factor_replicated_one_hot(index: Tuple[int]) → jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray[source]

Right-multiply a replicated-one-hot vector by a factor B of the Fisher.

Here the ‘Fisher’ is the Fisher information matrix (i.e. expected outer- product of gradients) with respect to the parameters of the underlying probability distribution (whose log-prob defines the loss). Typically this will be block-diagonal across different cases in the batch, since the distribution is usually (but not always) conditionally iid across different cases.

A ‘replicated-one-hot’ vector means a tensor which, for each slice along the batch dimension (assumed to be dimension 0), is 1.0 in the entry corresponding to the given index and 0 elsewhere.

Note that B can be any matrix satisfying B * B^T = H where H is the Fisher, but will agree with the one used in the other methods of this class.

Parameters

index – A tuple representing in the index of the entry in each slice that is 1.0. Note that len(index) must be equal to the number of elements of the ‘fisher_factor_inner_shape’ tensor minus one.

Returns

The vector right-multiplied by B. Will be of the same shape(s) as the ‘inputs’ property.

abstract property fisher_factor_inner_shape: Sequence[int]

The shape of the tensor returned by multiply_fisher_factor.

abstract sample(rng_key: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray[source]

Sample ‘targets’ from the underlying distribution.

grad_of_evaluate_on_sample(rng_key: jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray, coefficient_mode: str) → Sequence[jax._src.numpy.lax_numpy.ndarray][source]

Evaluates the gradient of the log probability on a random sample.

Parameters

  • rng_key – Jax PRNG key for sampling.

  • coefficient_mode – The coefficient mode to use for evaluation.

Returns

The gradient of the log probability of targets sampled from the distribution.
